instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A (iSight bad) need schematic.
threads.message:
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that has a damaged part near the monitor plug. iSight is not working.
Does anyone have schematics for this 

I think I can get by without it.  It is close to the same design as the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> just different placement arrangement but if anyone has this board view / schematic I want it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A (iSight bad) need schematic.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A (iSight bad) need schematic.
threads.message: I was able to fix the iSight.  Had a damaged inductor supplying 5v to camera as well as damaged LVD interface cable.  Unit was a water damaged unit.   Thankfully apple put ground next to the 5v rail in the LVD plug or it would of toasted the CPU data lines.
